attributes.action: UK to introduce ‘ISSUE DATE’ passport checks prior to EU travel and UK campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it not common knowledge? to the UK general public regards passport validity, whilst travelling from the UK-EU. The rules stipulate ‘ISSUE DATE’ issued less than 10 years ago and at least 3 months left before expiry date.
Over and over again, individuals are been turned away at UK check-in desks/borders. Having no clue their ‘ISSUE DATE’ has expired?
It’s time to act and get the message out AGAIN!
Whilst highlighting on passport portals.
I propose simple changes, to end peoples misery.
attributes.background: Ask the UK travel industry to introduce an ‘ISSUE DATE’ section on passport portals,prior to departure travel from UK-EU.Flagging up,out of date passports,informing customers prior to travel.‘HM passport office’ to further campaign to UK general public regards passport rules/validity UK-EU travel.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Whether to request the issue date of passport holders is a matter for individual travel companies, not the Government or Parliament.
